2101.11778.sentence: Consequently, many people feel a lack of agency over their app use, which is linked to negative life effects such as loss of sleep.
2101.11778.label: Background

2101.11778.sentence: In the attention economy, video apps employ design mechanisms like autoplay that exploit psychological vulnerabilities to maximize watch time.
2101.11778.label: Background

2101.11778.sentence: Prior design research has innovated external mechanisms that police multiple apps, such as lockout timers.
2101.11778.label: Background

2101.11778.sentence: We discuss implications for how designers can help users reclaim a sense of agency over their media use.
2101.11778.label: Background

2101.11778.sentence: digital wellbeing, sense of agency, social media, YouTube
2101.11778.label: Other

2101.11778.sentence: In this work, we shift the focus to how the internal mechanisms of an app can support user agency, taking the popular YouTube mobile app as a test case.
2101.11778.label: Objective

2101.11778.sentence: From a survey of 120 U.S. users, we find that autoplay and recommendations primarily undermine sense of agency, while search and playlists support it.
2101.11778.label: Result

2101.11778.sentence: From 13 co-design sessions, we find that when users have a specific intention for how they want to use YouTube they prefer interfaces that support greater agency.
2101.11778.label: Result
